headline.main: DEATH OF TRISTAM BURGESS.; Sketch of his Life and Public Career.

docs.lead_paragraph: The TIMES of yesterday morning announced the death of TRISTAM BURGESS, of Rhode Island. So long a period has elapsed since his name figured among the actors on the stage of public life, that very few of our readers are probably aware of the prominence it once held and of the degree of public attention his speeches commanded.

headline.main: BOSTON.; Democrat and Whigs in Fanonil Hall-- r. Lawrence and Mr. Everett-Hoosac Tannel-Banks of Boston-Forgery-Railroad Strikes, &-c.

docs.lead_paragraph: All our political fermentations are going on here pretty briskly. Faneuil Hall has just been hearing both sides, and will doubtless decide the matter before Independence Day. The Democratic Ratification meeting took place within its walls, the evening before last, and the Whig meeting last evening. The first was well attended, but not inordinately enthusiastic. byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: In the New-York Medical Times for October, Dr. JOHN WATSON has some clinical observations on the surgical diseases of childhood, from which several points are deduced: First, that injury to the limbs of the young is apt to lead to arrested development, causing lameness; and second, to severe inflammation around the spongy heads of bones and separation of the cartilaginous

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE HUMBOLDT.; INTERESTING FROM EUROPE. Presentation of the Crown of St. Stephen to the Emperor of Austria. Arrest of a Scotch Lady in Tuscany for giving to a Peasant a Copy of the Bible. THE EASTERN QUESTION. Hungarian and Italian Refugees joining the Turkish Army in vast numbers. 100,000 Men on the Persian Frontier. 15,000 Egyptians on the March for Varna. Russian Troops Pouring into Southern Russia. Summary of News. The Eastern Question. The Eastern Question. Count Nesselrode's Dispatch. The Case of Miss Cunninghame. TURKEY. From the Principalities. The Cholern.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. Mail steamship Humboldt arrived at this port last evening. She brings the large number of 216 passengers, and 400 tons of merchandise. She had a rough passage for the season, having experienced a successon of strong westerly gales and rough head seas.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; EPISCOPAL CONVENTION. Triennial Convention of the Protestant Episcopal Church. FORMAL DEPOSITION OF BISHOP IVES.

docs.lead_paragraph: NINTH DAY. The Convention reassembled in St. John's Chapel, at 10 A. M., yesterday. Morning prayer was read by Rev. Dr. ATKINSON, of Maryland, (Bishop elect to North Carolina ;) Rev. Dr. WATSON, of New-Jersey, read the lessons.
